title: Sri Lanka parliament deputy speaker resigns after SLFP quits government
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Deputy Speaker of Sri Lanka’s parliament Ranjith Siyambalapitiya resigned from the position Tuesday (05) morning following the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP)’s decision to withdraw from the crisis-hit government.
In a letter addressed to President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, Siyambalapitiya said his resignation was in line with the SLFP’s decision to quit the government.

The SLFP announced the move on Monday (04) following reports that the entire cabinet of ministers had handed over their letters of resignation to Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa Sunday (03) night. The legality of the mass resignation has been questioned by experts.
The SLFP also rejected an invitation by President Rajapaksa to form an interim administration with the participation of all parties that represent parliament.

Rajapaksa appointed a four-member cabinet Monday morning with former Justice Minister Ali Sabry now serving as Minister of Finance. Education Minister Dinesh Gunawardena, Foreign Minister G L Peiris and Highways Minister Johnston Fernando were reappointed to their former cabinet positions. (Colombo/Apr05/2022)
